content.description: Climb up the left side of the arete on big scoops and pull over onto the slab to clip the first bolt at 20ft. Easy climbing past two more bolts to the anchors. Little dirty, but worth doing if your going to climb Body English to the right.
content.protection: 3 bolts. R rating to the first bolt. Shares anchors with Body English 10a R

content.description: The route has three or four bolts and an anchor.
content.location: This route is located on the back side of the Mind Dart formation and faces away from the road. From a point where the road into Alpers Canyon goes steeply uphill, walk uphill toward the cliff to a small pass. Cross over the pass onto the back (east) side of the formation and walk a short way downhill (south) to reach the climb.

content.description: Clip a bolt 8 feet off the ground and step up left between 2 seams and clip another bolt at about 18 feet. Climb up the face between the seams for one more bolt with optional gear placements to 1". After pulling onto a ledge slightly to the right, clip one more bolt at chest level and run for the anchors 20 feet above on another ledge. The climbing is fairly continuous 5.8 from this point with no protection after pulling a 5.9 move from the ledge. Keep your head for the final moves as this route has 40 foot fall potential if you blow it just below the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts, optional gear to 1". Ring anchors.
content.location: This is the right route on the west face of Mind Dart Rock.

climbs.name: Altoids
climbs.fa: Mark Bowling, Steve Gerberding, Alan Bartlett, August 2000

content.description: Large pockets with an exciting wide step right near the top.
content.protection: 5 bolts on the face.  Two bolts with rap rings for anchors.
content.location: This route starts about 100 ft up and left from the base of Sierra Phantom.
